1.content: First thing's first, someone has to find the remote. To narrow down who, select the character's alignment.
1.title: Choose your character!

11.content: If they're aligned with Skyworld, there's really only two options.
11.title: Skyworld

111.content: Does this story begin before, during, or after the events of Kid Icarus: Uprising?
111.title: Pit

1112.content: This story takes place during the events of the game, but during what stage of the game in particular?
1112.title: During KI:U

11122.content: This describes a few different time periods. Which in particular?
11122.title: Hades & Viridi's time

11123.content:
"Well done, Pit!" said the voice of Nature herself. Pit triumphantly raised his fist toward the air. Or ground, considering the boss he just beat tied him in webbing upside down on the ceiling.

"Yeah! Combustified!" he said,

"You're just making words up at this point," Viridi replied. "Anyway, we're here looking for something that looks like a TV remote, so let me know if you find it."

Pit finally cut the webbing off of him with his bow, dropping gracefully to the ground. "What's the remote for? Changing intergalactic TV channels?"

"Not quite. They say it has the power to switch people's bodies," Viridi explained, "and considering that Palutena's probably being possessed, it seemed like a good thing to track down."

"Oh, that might come in handy!" Pit remarked. He looked at all the webs sprawled across the walls of the chamber. "I guess I'll just... get started then."

"I guess you will! I'm not gonna sit here and watch you cut through webs all day, so just tell me when you find it."

And with that, Viridi did whatever the telepathic equivalent of hanging up is.

Pit shrugged, then decided to cut a circle around his feet to start. He peeked the area he cut out and with great luck, the remote had been sitting right in front of his feet the whole time!

A thought occurred to Ol' Flightless, though. Could he really trust Viridi with access to something with this kind of power? They called a truce, but t
Skyworld and the Forces of Nature were still at war. For all he knew, she could just be using him to get her hands on it and use his body to finish Palutena off! But she wouldn't do something so horrible, would she?

What does Pit do?
11123.title: Mid-Game, VS. Chaos Kin

choices: The remote drops to the ground.
111231.content:
"I got it, Viridi."

Just as he said that, a natural light shone down from the heavens, tugging him toward the... aforementioned heavens.

"Great! I'll pull you back and we can look at it more closely."

And with that, Pit was extracted.

Viridi was waiting for him in the main chamber, something unusual for her. Pit rose the remote up high and waved it as he approached her.

"Good! You've got the remote!" Viridi said, grinning.

"I did just say so, you know."

"Hand it over, would you?"

Pit stopped walking. "...why?"

Viridi cocked her head to the side. "What does that mean? I just want to look at it."

Pit crossed his arms. "How do I know you don't just want to use it to swap my body with a toad or something so that I'm not a problem for your army later?"

Viridi's eyes widened. "Huh!? That's not... I hadn't even thought of that."

"Oh no."

"Listen, Pit. I'm not going to do that while Palutena's still rampaging. I really do just want to look at it."

Viridi grabbed for the remote, but Pit simply pulled it away from her further. "I don't think I trust you with this."

"Pit, come on!" Viridi cried. She grabbed for it again.

Pit pulled it back, far behind his head, more aggressively than before. "No! Prove to me I can trust you!"

"Oh, that's it, little angel! Give it here!"

Viridi lunged at Pit, gripping the remote as tightly as Pit had been. They found themselves in a celestial tug of war, but who was the victor?
111231.title: Tell Viridi

choices: She honestly did just want to look at it.
She intended to use it for her own purposes.
1112312.content:
One particularly impassioned tug of the remote later, and Pit lost both his grip on the remote and balance. That balance was further disrupted by Viridi kicking him in the stomach, knocking him to the ground.

"Ugh..."

"You're really stubborn, you know that?" Viridi remarked, eyeing the remote up and down.

"Please don't use that on me! I like my body! It has really good gas mileage and stuff!"

What did Viridi intend to do with the remote?
1112312.title: Viridi gets it.

choices: They call a truce on the matter.
1112313.content:
With one particularly hearty tug from both parties, the remote dropped from their hands, crashing to the ground. On impact, the backplate flew off, leaving what appeared to be some kind of compartment exposed.

Pit glared at Viridi. "Now look what you did!"

"Oh, cut it out with the cliché blame game, would you!?" Viridi cried, picking the remote up. Her curious stare at the back compartment prompted Pit to look over her shoulder at it.

"...'Command'?" Pit asked. "What's that?"

"I don't know any more than you do! None of the legends mentioned anything about a Command function!" Viridi said. A mischievous smile slowly crept onto her face. "But I guess there's only one way to find out!"

Viridi spun around, remote pointing directly at Pit, but just as quickly he slapped it out of her hand, sending it sliding across the room.

Who gets to it first? Or do they stop fighting over it after all?
1112313.title: The remote drops to the ground.

choices: Try and resolve this some other way.
11123131.content:
Pit dashed towards the remote, diving toward it at breakneck speed. Thank the Gods my weapon has a speed modifier, he thought. He grabbed it off the floor before Viridi could even make it halfway, and even quicker than that, he pointed it to Viridi and hit "command."

Instantly, she stopped running. In fact, she stopped moving entirely, staring right in front of her with a blank expression on her face.

"Uh... Viridi?" Pit asked. He waved a hand in front of her eyes, but got no reaction. So he tried flicking her arm, and she didn't react to that either.

"Can you hear me? Please nod your head or something if you can!"

Viridi nodded, her expression returning to her as she did so. After a moment's pause, though, she wordlessly dashed towards Pit, prompting him to hit the button on her again.

"Whoa! That was out of nowhere!" Pit said, mostly to himself. "I wish you'd just forget about trying to take this thing for a second."

Viridi's expression returned again, but this time, she didn't nod, nor did she try and charge Pit. In fact, she simply stared at Pit for a second, and then put a hand to her cheek in thought. "Shoot... what was I just doing?" Viridi said.

That settled it for Pit, though he probably should have realized what it would do from the name In retrospect. "Command" let him give commands that the target has to obey! He hit the pondering goddess with it once again.

He had to make sure it was really working. "What's something Viridi would never do in a million years...?" Pit pondered to himself.

"Oh! Viridi, do a little twirl and then tell me that you think I'm really cool."

Viridi's expression returned, appearing surprised and she twirled around in a circle. "Pit, I think you're really cool," she then said. As quickly as it came out, Viridi's face went redder than her outfit. "Uh... psyche! Why would I even say that!? Haha...!"

Pit used another command on her, just to keep her from acting out again.

Now he had to decide what to do with her.
What does he do?
11123131.title: Pit gets it.

choices: "It doesn't look like there's anything here."
"It looks like... some kind of remote?"
1113.content:
"Take that, Cragalanche!"

"That's it! I'm putting a tarp over that weak spot!"

Pit took a moment to catch his breath. "I bet I didn't even need that weak spot to win, Viridi!" He shouted to the heavens.

"Oh, please," the heavens replied. "If it wasn't for that Mega Laser, you would've lost already."

"Pit," said a second voice from above, "I know you're ready to bicker with Viridi all day, but we need to keep moving. I feel a strange energy reading up ahead."

Pit nodded before dashing forward.

After the war with the Underworld ended, Viridi and the Forces of Nature quickly resumed their conflict with humanity, and Palutena's Army just as quickly joined the fight against her. So quickly, in fact, that Cragalanche didn't even have time to seal up the weak spot on his backside. That brings us to today.

A few action packed encounters later, he came to a large flat patch of ground. surrounded by trees. His eyes scanned the area for anything strange, but all he found were some small rocks.

"So, uh, what am I looking for?"

"I'm not sure," said Palutena. "Somehow, I can't see anything inside that area. Tell me if you find anything."

"That's because I'm blocking you!" Said the Goddess of Nature with a smug grin, arms crossed. "This area has a telepathic field around it so I can hold meetings without anyone eavesdropping. I know you have one just like it wrapped around Skyworld."

Pit looked closer at the rocks. One in particular seemed to be... oddly rectangular? "Huh." Pit said.

"Did you find something, Pit?" said Palutena.

Pit picked up the rock. Flipping it over, he found a small sheet of paper and a load of buttons. What could this be?

Maybe I ought to keep this a secret until I know what it does, he thought. But I'd feel bad keeping something like this from Lady Palutena. Hmm...

"Uh... Earth to Pit? Or... Skyworld to Pit? Are you there?"

How does Pit respond?
1113.title: Post-Game, VS. the Forces of Nature

11131.content:
"It doesn't look like there's anything here, Lady Palutena."

Pit could make out a sigh of relief from Viridi's side of the telepathic conversation as he slipped the remote and sheet of paper into his pocket.

"Really?" Palutena said. "That's a shame. I guess that energy reading was just the telepathic jammer Viridi mentioned."

"Yup! That's all!" Viridi cried all too loudly.

"Well, in any case, Pit, we defeated Cragalanche, which means we can still call this mission a success. Step away from that area so I can extract you."

"Already on it, Lady Palutena!"

----------------------------------

That night in his sleeping quarters, Pit pulled the remote and instructions from his pocket. Examining both closely, he discovered that the sheet of paper was a set of instructions for the remote, which, according to the aforementioned sheet of paper, had the power to swap people's bodies!

"Whoa, this is incredible!" Pit said to himself. "...if It works, that is."

Which led him to an important question.

How can I find out whether it works or not? Pit pondered. I have to try something!

What does he try?
11131.title: Pit hides the remote

111311.content:
Something mischievous awoke in Pit. As long as it wasn't hurting her, maybe trying it out on Palutena could be fun.

Pit snuck out of his quarters and crept into Palutena's temple, making sure to make his way in through the hidden back entrance.

Palutena stood half-awake the main hall of the temple, which Pit recognized as the goddess equivalent of sleep. He knew she wasn't going to notice him in that state, so he produced the remote from his pocket and began to consider his options.

What did he decide to do?
111311.title: Test it on Palutena

11131112.content:
If his goal was to avoid being caught, this was certainly the best way of doing so. As the Goddess of Light stood half-asleep, he selected her using "Unaware Swap", then himself.

As the button went down, Pit found himself standing over a foot taller than he had a few seconds prior. He saw himself, however, standing in the middle of the hall where Palutena had just stood. But he, still in the back of the room, hadn't moved. He just looked like Palutena now.

Pit stumbled over himself at the realization of that fact, hearing the click of his now hard wooden shoes on the floor. Palutena didn't seem to have noticed anything, however, as she was still staring at the front door, fast half-asleep.

That certainly proved that remote's chops! But now he was in Palutena's body, and only he even knew! What should he do now?
11131112.title: Unaware Swap

1113113.content: Something else happens, but what?
1113113.title: Other

11132.content:
"I found something. It looks like... some kind of remote?"

"Darn it!" Viridi cried. "Uh... I mean... nothing!"

"Hm..." Palutena said. "It seems like you aren't too happy about what he found."

Viridi gave a hesitant chuckle. "Actually, I'm very happy. I wanted him to find it!"

"Pit, she's lying."

"I know, Lady Palutena."

With that, the light of extraction shone from the heavens, pulling him back home.

---------------

The next morning, Pit woke up to find a note by his beside.

"Pit, come see me as soon as you wake up. -Palutena"

He obeyed, dashing to the temple with haste. He burst through the front doors, remote in hand.

"What's up?"

"Good, you brought the remote with you. We have to find out what it is and why Viridi was so upset when we found it."

"Oh, of course!" Pit agreed with an enthusiastic nod. "But how do we do that?"

"That's a good question. I doubt a device like that comes with a manual."

Does Pit remember that it, in fact, did come with a manual?
11132.title: "It looks like... some kind of remote?"

info.brief_description: A KI:U character finds a remote with the power to swap bodies.
info.description:
A Kid Icarus Uprising character will come across a remote. This remote comes with a set of instructions and gives them the ability to perform seven functions:

Aware Swap: The user selects two targets, at which point their bodies will be swapped. This is the traditional Freaky Friday-style body swap, in which both parties are aware of what happened.

Unaware Swap: The user selects two targets, at which point their bodies will be swapped. Everyone but the user of the remote will believe that the targets have always had the bodies they swapped into.

Possession: Turns the user into a ghost-like entity. When the user flies into another person, the user possesses their body until they use the remote to leave. The user leaves a copy of their consciousness into their original body who acts as if nothing happened, and the remote follows the user.

Shapeshift: A first target is selected, and the target's body (and clothes) are saved into the remote's memory. When a second target is selected, the second target's body morphs into that of the first target. The first target is unaffected. Multiple people's bodies can be saved and switched between on the remote, and there is also an "undo button" for this function specifically that restores a target's original body.

Personality Swap: Self-explanatory. The user selects to targets, at which point their personalities will be swapped. Likes, dislikes, mannerisms, thought processes, behaviors, etc., are all switched. The targets may or may not notice that their personality has changed.

Clone: Like possession, but the copy of the user possesses the target's body - not the user themself. The copy is just as aware of the circumstances as the original. Up to 10 targets can be possessed by clones, and any targets possessed after the tenth will release the earliest target from possession.

Command: Found in a hidden compartment on the remote and not mentioned in the instructions. The target's mind will go completely empty until the user gives them a command, at which point they will carry the command out. They will be aware that they were performing the action against their will, but will not know why they are doing so. They will not know anything happened if the command is a mental change, however (i.e. "forget about that argument", or "you now like pizza").

There is also a reset button in the same hidden compartment as the above. This resets all swaps, shapeshifts, or commands, returning everything affected to the state it was in before the remote was first used. (This does not rewind time. Everything that happens before the reset takes place still happened.)

Rules:

Don't do anything that wouldn't be allowed under KI:U's age guidelines. That means no sex, drugs, graphic violence, etc.

No endings. Even if a plotline is resolved, the path should be allowed to continue.

No character death.

Power shouldn't corrupt. If someone's going to use the remote in a world-domination scheme, it should be someone who would have wanted to take over the world beforehand in the first place.

Ships are okay, but there must be an option to avoid it. Try not to force any plotline if it can be helped.

No excessive use of OC's. OC's, if any, should only exist to further the plot of other characters.

Anything that breaks these rules may be deleted and replaced without warning.

Message the story owner if anything is unclear.
